records.location_details: Inside the Maltese Search and Rescue Zone, specifically at 34 55 N, 19 45 E, where a migrant boat was sighted and later intercepted by the Tareq Bin Zeyad vessel.
records.location_text_raw: inside the Maltese Search and Rescue zone on 24/05/2023. Frontex sighting 490 of a migrant boat inside the Maltese Search and Rescue Zone on 23/05/2023. Position (34 55 N, 19 45 E), inside the Maltese Search and Rescue Region. Tracked at N 34 51 E 19 46 at 6:10h CEST of 24 May.

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of torture and inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 6 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 19 (2) of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: An NGO reported about SOS messages from a vessel with approximately 500 persons on board, later updated to 600+ POB by Frontex, which was allegedly returned to Libya from within the Maltese Search and Rescue zone. A 'Libyan sea military unit' (Tareq Bin Zeyad vessel) was observed towing the migrant boat.
records.evidence_quote: An NGO reported online about SOS messages received from a vessel with approximately 500 persons on board and claimed that they where later returned to Libya from within the Maltese Search and Rescue zone on 24/05/2023. Frontex further received photographs from EUNAVFOR MED reporting that an aerial asset had observed the towing of a migrant boat by a "Libyan sea military unit" the same day.

records.location_details: Interception occurred in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region, with the interception itself taking place in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region.
records.where_clear: Libyan SRR, intercepted in Maltese SRR
records.location_text_raw: in the Libyan SRR (interception in Maltese SRR)
records.country_or_area: Libyan Search and Rescue Region, Maltese Search and Rescue Region
records.geocodable_query: Libyan Search and Rescue Region, Maltese Search and Rescue Region
records.uncertainty_note: Interception occurred across two SAR regions, specific coordinates not provided.

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of torture and inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 6 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
Article 19 (2) of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: This incident is cited as another case where Tareq Bin Zeyad was involved following a Frontex sighting, with allegations of migrants being returned to Libya. The same vessel was reportedly seen in NGO video footage.
records.evidence_quote: It further notes that in a later incident (SIR 13079/2023), that equally looked into allegations of migrants being returned to Libya, the same vessel, Tareq Bin Zeyad, can be seen at the scene in the video footage of an NGO.
